intro: Calceolaria oligantha, commonly known as the slender slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or blue in color. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its striking appearance, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its ornamental value.
